div.l: And symkyn had hosen of the same
Ther dorst no wight clepen here but dame
Was noon so hardy that went by the weye
That with here dorste rage or ones pleye
But if he wolde be slayn of Symkyn
With panaddepandepanade or with knyf or boydekyn
For Ialous folk ben ꝑperilous eủere mo
Algate they wolde hir wyues wende so
And ek for she was somdel smoterlich
She was as dygne as water in a dich
And ful of hoker and of besmare
Hir thoughte that a lady sholde hir spare
What for hir kynrede and hir nortelrye
That she had lerned in the Nonnerye
A daughter had thei bitwix hem two
Of twenty yeer with outen any mo
Sauyng a child that was of half yeer age
In cradel it lay and was a ꝓpropre page
This wenche thikke and wel y growen waas
With camuse nose and eyen grey as glaas
With buttokes brode and brestes rounde and heie
But right fair was hir her y wol nat lye
The ꝑperson of the toun for she was fayr
In purpos was to maken hir his hair
But of his catel and of his mesuage
And strange he made it of hir mariage
His purpos was for to bestowe hir heye
In to som worthi blood of ancestrie
For holy chirches good mot ben despended
On holi cherches blod thar is descended
Ther fore he wolde his holy blood honoure
Though that he hoalyhalyholy cherch sholde deuoure
Greet sookne hath this myln̉er out of doute
With whete and malte of al the londe a boute
